definition: between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: The President of the United States election implement indirect elections.
sentences.chinese: 美國總統選舉實行間接選舉制。

sentences.english: Indirect elections take place at national and provincial levels and in cities with sub-districts.
sentences.chinese: 在設區的市和省以至中央實行間接選舉。

sentences.english: Too many levels of indirect election are not conducive to enhancing the representativeness of the institutions.
sentences.chinese: 過多層次的間接選舉不利於提高代表機關的代表性。

sentences.english: The President and Vice-President are elected indirectly by an electoral college for five-year terms.
sentences.chinese: 總統和副總統每五年由選舉團間接選舉產生。

sentences.english: Indirect election puts an end to the possible unhealthy tendencies during elections.
sentences.chinese: 間接選舉杜絕了選舉過程中可能產生的不正之風。

sentences.english: Indirect elections are held for the leadership of the provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities with districts, as well as the central authorities.
sentences.chinese: 在省和設區的市以至中央，實行間接選舉。
